A short two block walk to the beach and the inlet of the bay, we made the walk multiple times per day just to take in the scenery or walk our dogs. The neighborhood is darling and everyone waves as they drive past. We used the house as a place to relax and go on little adventures to Pt Lavaca, Indianola, Port OConnor and Seadrift.
The kitchen was perfect to cook - if you wanted - or heat up leftovers like we did. The bed and the couch and chairs were super comfy and we laughed more than once that we had driven five hours to lay on someone else's couch, but that is what good weekend get aways are for.
There was plenty of hot water for long showers and plenty of towels for bathing. We did not use the beach for swimming so I cant say if there were beach towels, but we always bring our own.
There is a little market in the neighborhood, otherwise Pt Lavaca has everything you might forget to bring. And we didnâ€™t try it, but renting kayaks or paddleboards would be perfect as you can put in just a few blocks from the house.
Definitely pack bug spray, because this is Texas!
Absolutely great getaway spot. We have already recommended to friends.

This is a wonderful beach cottage 4 blocks from Magnolia Beach. Bernadette had great and timely communication which makes everything so easy. The cottage itself was super clean and the beach dÃ©cor was especially thoughtful. You can tell it's been recently renovated and for sure the cutest cottage on the block! The king size bed was very nice given it's a 1 bedroom and our 3 year old loved the bunk beds. Overall I would recommend this cottage and really was a great value even during peak summer season.
Tips: Research Magnolia Beach. This beach is ideal for fishing on the piers, sitting with your chairs and enjoying the view. It's free and you can easily drive your car right up close to the water. However it does have a large amount of shells. So water shoes are recommended so you don't cut your feet. Not ideal for smaller children who are looking to play in the sand and build sand castles. Rockport or Port Aransas which is about 50 minutes away is much better for that.
Local Area - this is a small community with limited restaurants. So the kitchen is stocked with cooking utensils and a grill. So better to stop by HEB on the way in and stop up for your stay.
Don't forget all your own beach equipment and beach towels.
AirBNB details for this cottage: Everything lists correctly - just pointing out no washer or dryer. So be prepared to bring towels and beach wear home wet/air dried. 2 A/C window units that to work very well for living room and bathroom. Kitchen and bathroom run a few degrees warmer.
One small revision - AirBNB shows check in time is Noon. It is 3:00pm. We did request an early check in and Bernadette was able to accommodate a 1:00pm check in. Again, she is great at communication via the website message center.
